title: When did "Bookmark this page" change to "Bookmark current tab" From the Menu Bar?
content:
When running Firefox on Windows ...

At one time, when clicking "Bookmarks" on the Menu Bar, the second choice on the dropdown used to say "Bookmark this page." Now I see it says "Bookmark current tab."

Looking at some older YouTube instructional videos show that the "page" wording did indeed used to be used.

Does anyone know roughly with what release that change of wording occurred?

(BTW, hovering over the star at the end of the address field does still show the "Bookmark this page" wording.)
creator: marrer

title: Firefox Account May Have Been Compromised, How To Find Out More?
content:
I suspect my firefox account was compromised as I have found evidence of my email being tampered with and certain emails having been deleted and then deleted from my trash. I was able to use an email recovery addon to recover the emails.

I am currently investigating whether the breach was through my email or through firefox, as it is synced into my email. Unfortunately, gmail does not go back far enough to show any session activity beyond the last 10. I am trying to get in touch with somebody on that end to help me determine whether it was just my email.

I am reaching out here to ask if there is a way to see if there is a way to pull session activity on a firefox account. I checked security and found that only 3 devices had been signed onto my account, all of which were PCs/laptops that I owned. I signed out of all of the devices, relogged on my PC and changed my password and setup 2FA. There is a possibility of a fourth device having connected to my firefox but the suspect may have signed their device out.

My only other suspicion of any potential breach through firefox is one of my laptops that I had reformatted and gave away. Could someone have recovered my firefox login on that laptop and used that to sync into my firefox account and then gain access to my saved passwords and so on?

If that is the case, I can follow up on that and see who handled the laptop since it left my possession.

I appreciate any help in advance.
creator: ploomstarr

title: Firefox Hangs after Windows Wakes from Sleep (Hybrid Sleep?)
content:
After waking from sleep on a desktop (using hybrid sleep), sometimes Firefox becomes slow or completely hangs, across all Firefox windows, regardless of how well it was running before the computer went to sleep. (Some windows may be more frozen than others, but all become slow.) Other programs on the computer are unaffected. I usually have to kill the Firefox processes, which often results in loss of the 10-30 tabs I had open (no restore session prompt on restart). The issue does not self-resolve over a period of ~30 minutes after wake. On the most recent occurrence, I noticed one of the Firefox subprocesses sitting at ~20% CPU usage (one full core on a six-core machine, probably using single-core boost; CPU does not have hyperthreading) continuously. That's about the only clue I have.

Although I don't know if it's specifically related to hybrid sleep, this does not appear to happen on my laptop, which does not use hybrid sleep. It only happens after waking from sleep (not during normal use). There was no power loss in any of these cases, so the computer ought to be (and I believe is) waking from RAM rather than hibernation. Both machines are Windows 10 (and the desktop has significantly superior specs in all hardware; it's a cheap laptop vs. a workstation). The main SSD is nearly full, so the hiberfile is probably written to one of the HDDs, if that factors in at all. I use Google Docs and Drive quite a bit, and I've noticed some slowdowns on Firefox due to that in the past (years ago, different machine, when leaving the same tabs open for long periods of time), but that doesn't seem to be a consistent problem here. My only extensions are AdBlock Plus and Facebook Container. Firefox says it's up to date.

Thanks for any help!
creator: michaelalingsb

title: 3DSecure payment does not send POST request
content:
Hey! For a very long time, the ability to pay by card has ceased to work in the browser. After entering the card information, the browser redirects to a page with a 3DSecure form which is not automatically submitted. That is, a blank page with a hidden form opens (as it should be) and then nothing happens. The body of the page contains the JS code: document.postform.submit();

And it doesn't work, so the payment doesn't go through. This serious problem has not been resolved for a long time. Updates are installed last, add-ons are not used. Please help with the solution!

On Russian: Привет! Уже очень давно в браузере перестала работать возможность оплаты картой. После ввода информации о карте, браузер пересылает на страницу с формой 3dsecure которая не отправляется автоматически. То есть открывается пустая страница со скрытой формой (как и должно быть) и далее ничего не происходит. В теле страницы указан ЙС код: document.postform.submit();

И он не срабатывает, соответственно платёж не проходит. Это серьёзная проблема давно не может быть решена. Обновления установлены последние, дополнения не используются. Прошу помочь в решении!

title: I lost all my OneTab data on Firefox - I have no backups (that I know of)
content:
I discovered that I lost all the sessions from the OneTab extension that I have been using for a while. I am not sure when this happened, because I hadn't opened my OneTab in some time, but today I tried it because I wanted to file and categorize tabs I had saved, and they are sadly all gone!

Searching around I discovered this probably has to do with recent Firefox updates, but I haven't been able to find any backup of my extension data. I followed directions from this issue https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1260116 and this https://www.tenforums.com/software-apps/176858-how-i-export-my-profile-data-firefox-extension.html.

But no success. Any ideas if/where OneTab data could be? Or even which update could have broken the extension, if that could help?

Thanks so much for any help :)

Edit: I also wanted to add, because I saw it in some of the replies I found, that I have no Old Firefox Data folder, as I have never used the Refresh Firefox option. In fact, I remember getting a notification by Firefox some time ago to do this, but since it would involve having to reconfigure extensions etc, I chose not to (probably a bad idea!).

title: Drag/drop e-mail or attachment from Microsoft Office to Firefox
content:
Hello all,

Lately I received a report from some colleagues that a certain feature is not working in Firefox that appears to be working on any other browser.

When drag/dropping e-mails and/or attachments from Microsoft Outlook (Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise) to a drop-field in Firefox (88.0.1 - 64-bit) nothing happens.

When using Firefox we can drag/drop files from Windows Explorer, but not from Outlook.

The same fields do work flawlessly when drag/dropping e-mails and/or attachments from Microsoft Outlook in Google Chrome, Microsoft EDGE, Opera and Safari. So Firefox is the only browser - on several OS's - that does not allow e-mails/attachments to be dropped from Microsoft Outlook. We have tested multiple users on different workstation and we have tested drop-fields from several web applications.

Surprisingly I cannot find any solution to this. The only similar cases I was able to find are from a couple of years ago but are about the other way around (so drag/dropping files FROM Firefox to another application).

At this moment I am advising my colleagues to use another browser. But we really want this to work properly with any browser of choice. Hope this community can help us out.

Note: UAC is enabled on the workstations. Disabling does not affect anything. Tested attachments: .pdf, .docx, .html & .xlsx
creator: wouter.moed

title: Firefox installation on Windows 10 is being pirated by Microsoft 'BLING'
content: 05/27/2021 Launch of an existing version of Firefox resulted in a launch of Microsoft 'BLING'. All subsequent (multiple ) re-stallations result in the creation of a BLING application - with a Mozilla / Firefox shortcut icon.
